text:
Hi there, I have a strange issue with Webhooks i was hoping to get help with. As you  can see from this screenshot, this is an NPS survey submitted by one of our customers.

the comment is unfortunately missing from the data that is sent out. However, when I re-enroll the same feedback manually and trigger the webhook, it does send the comment out. It only fails when the customer submits the NPS survey. Hoping someone has an insight into why this may be happening

Just an example for when i re-enroll the same exact NPS survey response manually to trigger the webhook:

```"hs_content": {
      "versions": [
        {
          "name": "hs_content",
          "value": "Customer comment is here.",
          "timestamp": 1646231650662,
          "sourceId": "SubmissionFollowUpTq2Worker",
          "source": "SUCCESS",
          "sourceVid": []
        }
      ],
      "value": Customer comment is here.",
      "timestamp": 1646231650662,
      "source": "SUCCESS",
      "sourceId": "SubmissionFollowUpTq2Worker",
      "updatedByUserId": null
    },```
So, hs_content is missing when the customer submits the feedback and triggers the webhook initially.

Hi! Wondering if anyone can help with some issues we're running into with our HubSpot API & Power BI.

Main issue is the screenshots below â€“ around the API pulling back incorrect information compared to what is displayed in HubSpot:

TELSCO shows as closed won in the API, but it was lost in HubSpot.
